column4: my cifs share is messed up in ubuntu 11.04. It seems to be recursively mounted on itself. I can see the main directory list, but a dir list inside any dir gives the same list.
Is Ubuntu the server or the client in this case?
client. i have a seagate goflex nas as the server.
FWIW, it worked fine in 10.10
Can you pastebin the output of "find /path/to/mountpoint/"?
Assuming the filenames aren't secret :)
well, it won't go past the first dir...
http://paste.scsys.co.uk/114946
Did find go into an infinite loop or did it stop at some point? Did it give any error message?
i cut it short after about 10-15 seconds. seems like an infinite loop to me.
Can you pastebin the output of "mountpoint /media/goflex/Music/"?
no error per-se.
is not a mountpoint
Or just post it, as it should be only one line.
Can you pastebin the output of "stat /media/goflex/Music/"?
http://paste.scsys.co.uk/114947
fyi, i've been mounting it via fstab, not that it would matter, necessarily?
Can you pastebin the output of "stat /media/goflex/Music/Music/Music/"?
http://paste.scsys.co.uk/114948
They have different inode numbers. I'm not sure if there's any signifigance to that but it's interesting.
also, fwiwi, i can navigate through the network/windows shares menu in nautilus and see the share contents just fine.
You should also be able to access the files via ~/.gvfs then as a work around. Can you pastebin your /etc/fstab/ ?
oh! interesting. thanks! paste coming a sec.
http://paste.scsys.co.uk/114949
